feed.title: S/V Aranji |
feed.subtitle: Adventures of Sailing Vessel Aranji and it's crew.

entry.title: Our adventures aboard S/V Aranji
entry.content:
Welcome

This blog is about S/V Aranji and our adventures aboard it. It’s purpose is to share our life, desicions and memories. Hopefully you will enjoy it find it useful.

Aranji

Aranji is the main hero in these stories. It is a 1968 cutter-rigged aluminum sailboat. It was design by William Lapworh as a racing sailboat. It was built by Yacht Dynamics (was owned) in California.

History

“Aranji Declared Victor of Tahiti Race” —New Your Times

In 1968 Aranji participated in a race from LA to Tahiti (3,571 nautical miles). It took only 13 days and 13 hours for Henry Wheeler and his crew to sail on Aranji from LA to Tahiti.

First to finish and overall: Aranji (48' LOA) , Henry H. Wheeler (ET 20:12:27:24, CT 13:13:00:24)— Diane Arbus

References

  • New Your Times
  • Scuttlebutt Sailing News
